					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:16.10%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;656&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:13.56%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:49.60%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:13.56%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;20
979&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:16.10%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;2
782&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company also purchases additional grapes and bulk wine under one-time purchase or short-term agreements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The total of all grapes and bulk wine purchased was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$7.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$7.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$6.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million for the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Included in the totals of all grapes and bulk wine purchased are related party purchases &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million for the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Consolidation policy:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries
 all of which are wholly-owned.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All intercompany balances and transactions are eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 11pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Cost of sales:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Includes grape
 juice and bulk wine costs
 whether purchased or grown
 crush costs
 winemaking and processing costs
 bottling
 packaging
 warehousing and shipping and handling costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For vineyard produced grapes
 grape costs include annual farming costs and amortization of vineyard development expenditures.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For wines that age longer than one year
 winemaking and processing costs continue to be incurred and capitalized to the cost of wine
 which can range from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;36&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; months.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;No further costs are allocated to inventory once the product is bottled and available for sale.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:22.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:336.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:22.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;11.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:336.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Debt&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Revolving Credit Facility&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In March 2013
 Crimson and its subsidiaries entered into a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$60.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million revolving credit facility with American AgCredit
 FLCA
 as agent for the lenders identified in the revolving credit facility
 comprised of a revolving loan facility and a term revolving loan facility
 which together is secured by substantially all of Crimson&amp;#x2019;s assets.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The revolving credit facility is for up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$10.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million of availability in the aggregate for a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; year term
 and the term revolving credit facility is for up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$50.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in the aggregate for a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;fifteen&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; year term.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All obligations of Crimson under the revolving credit facility are collateralized by certain real property
 including vineyards and certain winery facilities of Crimson
 accounts receivable
 inventory and intangible&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition to unused line fees ranging from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.375%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 rates for the borrowings are priced based on a performance grid tied to certain financial ratios and the London Interbank Offered Rate. Effective October 1
 2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; the unused line fees range from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The revolving credit facility can be used to fund acquisitions
 capital projects and other general corporate purposes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Covenants include the maintenance of specified debt and equity ratios
 limitations on the incurrence of additional indebtedness
 limitations on dividends and other distributions to shareholders and restrictions on certain mergers
 consolidations and sales of assets.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; amounts have been borrowed under the revolving credit facility to date. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Term Loan&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;On November 10
 2015
&amp;nbsp;Pine Ridge Winery
 LLC&amp;nbsp;(&amp;#x201C;Borrower&amp;#x201D;)
 a wholly-owned subsidiary of Crimson entered into a senior secured term loan agreement (the &amp;#x201C;term loan&amp;#x201D;) with American AgCredit
 FLCA (&amp;#x201C;Lender&amp;#x201D;) for an aggregate principal amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$16.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million. Amounts outstanding under the term loan will bear a fixed interest rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.24%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;The term loan will mature on &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;October 1
 2040&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; (the &amp;#x201C;Maturity Date&amp;#x201D;). On the first day of each January
 April
 July and October
 commencing January 1
 2016
 a principal payment in the amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$160
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; and an interest payment equal to the amount of all interest accrued through the previous day shall be made. A final payment of all unpaid principal
 interest and any other charges with respect to the term loan shall be due and payable on the Maturity Date.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;The Company incurred debt issuance costs&amp;nbsp;of approximately&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; million&amp;nbsp;related to this term loan. These costs are recorded as a reduction from short-term or long-term debt
 based on the timeframe in which the fees will be expensed (i.e. &amp;#x2013; expensed within 12-months shall be classified against short-term debt). The costs are being amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method over the contractual term of the loan. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;Borrower&amp;#x2019;s&amp;nbsp;obligations under the&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name=jump_exp_9&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;term loan are&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name=jump_exp_11&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;guaranteed by the Company. All obligations of&amp;nbsp;Borrower&amp;nbsp;under the term loan are collateralized by certain real property of the Company.&amp;nbsp;Borrower&amp;#x2019;s covenants include the maintenance of a specified debt service coverage ratio&amp;nbsp;and certain customary affirmative and negative covenants
 including limitations on the incurrence of additional indebtedness; limitations on distributions to shareholders; and restrictions on certain investments
 sale of assets and merging or consolidating with other persons.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;Events of default under the term loan include
 among others
 the following:&amp;nbsp;failure to make payments when due
 breach of covenants
 breach of representations or warranties
 cessation of operations and the incurrence of certain environmental liabilities.&amp;nbsp;In the case of any of the foregoing events of default
 Lender may
 but is not obligated to
 accelerate all amounts due under the term loan and cause them to become immediately due and payable. In the case of an event of default arising from certain events of bankruptcy or insolvency
 amounts due under the term loan will be accelerated and become immediately due and payable.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;The full &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$16.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million was drawn at closing and the term loan can be used to fund acquisitions
 capital projects and other general corporate purposes. As of December 31
 2015
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$16.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million in principal was outstanding
 net of unamortized loan fees of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;The Company was in compliance with all debt covenants as of December 31
 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt;Loan fees: Fees incurred with the issuance of the Company&amp;#x2019;s debt are recorded in the consolidated balance sheets as a reduction to associated debt balances
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;consistent with the short-term or long-term classification of the related debt outstanding at the end of the reporting period&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt;. The Company amortizes debt discount to interest expense over the contractual or expected term of the debt using the effective interest method.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Depletion allowances -&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; The Company pays depletion allowances to its distributors based on their sales to their customers.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These allowances are estimated on a monthly basis by the Company
 and allowances are accrued as a reduction of sales.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Subsequently
 distributors will bill the Company for actual depletions
 which may be different from the Company&amp;#x2019;s estimate.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Any such differences are recognized in sales when the bill is received.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company has historically been able to estimate depletion allowances without any material differences between actual and estimated expense.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;10.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Stockholders&amp;#x2019; Equity and Equity Incentive Plan&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;On February 25
 2013
 Crimson was recapitalized
 authorized shares were increased to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;150
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; common shares
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$.01&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; par value
 and Leucadia distributed &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;24
458
368&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; Crimson common shares to Leucadia shareholders.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition
 the Company is authorized to issue &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;15
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; shares of one or more series of preferred stock; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; preferred stock has been issued.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; dilutive or complex equity instruments or securities outstanding at any time during the periods presented.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In February 2013
 the Company adopted the 2013 Omnibus Incentive Plan
 which provides for the granting of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1
000
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; stock options or other common stock based awards.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The terms of awards that may be granted
 including vesting and performance criteria
 if any
 will be determined by the Company&amp;#x2019;s board of directors.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; awards have been granted to date.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In March 2014
 the Board of Directors of Crimson authorized a share repurchase program&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;that provides for the repurchase of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million of outstanding common stock. Under the&amp;nbsp;share&amp;nbsp;repurchase program
 any repurchased shares are&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name=jump_exp_1&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;constructively&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name=jump_exp_2&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;retired.&amp;nbsp;As of&amp;nbsp;December 31
 2015
&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;Company&amp;nbsp;had repurchased&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;151
812&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;shares&amp;nbsp;which were constructively retired&amp;nbsp;at an original repurchase cost of&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On February 29
 2016 the repurchase program was completed. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Financial instruments and fair value:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Investments available for sale include a US Treasury Note and Certificates of Deposits at December 31
 2015
 and Certificates of Deposit at December 31
 2014.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;All of the Company&amp;#x2019;s available for sale securities are either Level 1 or Level 2 and recorded at fair value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Available for sale securities that mature greater than 12 months from original investment are recorded as short-term because the securities represent the investment of funds that are available for current operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Net unrealized gains and losses
 net of tax
 on available for sale securities are recorded in accumulated other comprehensive loss.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Unrealized losses that are considered other than temporary are recorded in other income (expense) &amp;#x2013; net
 with the corresponding reduction to the carrying basis of the investment.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; other than temporary losses were recorded &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;during the three year period ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 31
 2015. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Fair value hierarchy:&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In determining fair value
 we maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs by requiring that observable inputs be used when available. Observable inputs are inputs that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability based on market data obtained from independent sources. Unobservable inputs reflect our assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability developed based on the best information available in the circumstances. We apply a hierarchy to categorize our fair value measurements broken down into three levels based on the transparency of inputs as follows: &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Level&amp;nbsp;1:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Quoted prices are available in active markets for identical assets or liabilities at the reported date. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Level&amp;nbsp;2:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Pricing inputs are other than quoted prices in active markets
 which are either directly or indirectly observable as of the reported date. The nature of these financial instruments include cash instruments for which quoted prices are available but traded less frequently
 derivative instruments whose fair value have been derived using a model where inputs to the model are directly observable in the market
 or can be derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data
 and instruments that are fair valued using other financial instruments
 the parameters of which can be directly observed. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:09.00%;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Level&amp;nbsp;3:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:491.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Instruments that have little to no pricing observability at the reported date. These financial instruments are measured using management&amp;#x2019;s best estimate of fair value
 where the inputs into the determination of fair value require significant management judgment or estimation. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Financial instruments are valued at quoted market prices
 if available. Certain financial instruments have bid and ask prices that can be observed in the marketplace. For financial instruments whose inputs are based on bid-ask prices
 the financial instrument is valued at the point within the bid-ask range that meets our best estimate of fair value. We use prices and inputs that are current at the measurement date. For financial instruments that do not have readily determinable fair values using quoted market prices
 the determination of fair value is based upon consideration of available information
 including types of financial instruments
 current financial information
 restrictions on dispositions
 fair values of underlying financial instruments and quotations for similar instruments. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The valuation of financial instruments may include the use of valuation models and other techniques. Adjustments to valuations derived from valuation models may be made when
 in management&amp;#x2019;s judgment
 features of the financial instrument such as its complexity
 the market in which the financial instrument is traded and risk uncertainties about market conditions require that an adjustment be made to the value derived from the models. Adjustments from the price derived from a valuation model reflect management&amp;#x2019;s judgment that other participants in the market for the financial instrument being measured at fair value would also consider in valuing that same financial instrument. To the extent that valuation is based on models or inputs that are less observable or unobservable in the market
 the determination of fair value requires more judgment. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The availability of observable inputs can vary and is affected by a wide variety of factors
 including
 for example
 the type of financial instrument and market conditions. As the observability of prices and inputs may change for a financial instrument from period to period
 this condition may cause a transfer of an instrument among the fair value hierarchy levels. Transfers among the levels are recognized at the beginning of each period. The degree of judgment exercised in determining fair value is greatest for instruments categorized in Level 3. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Review of Long-lived Assets for Impairment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; - For intangible assets with definite lives
 impairment testing is required if conditions exist that indicate the carrying value may not be recoverable.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For intangible assets with indefinite lives and for goodwill
 impairment testing is required at least annually or more frequently if events or circumstances indicate that these assets might be impaired.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company currently has no intangible assets with indefinite lives.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Substantially all of the Company&amp;#x2019;s goodwill and other intangible assets result from the acquisition of Seghesio Family Vineyards in May 2011.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Amortization of intangible assets is recorded on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful lives of the assets
 which range from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company evaluates goodwill for impairment at the end of each year
 and has concluded that goodwill is not impaired.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company evaluates long-lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset or asset group may not be recoverable.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Long-lived assets consist primarily of property and equipment.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Circumstances that might cause the Company to evaluate its long-lived assets for impairment could include a significant decline in the prices of the Company or the industry can charge for its products
 which could be caused by general economic or other factors
 changes in laws or regulations that make it difficult or more costly for the Company to distribute its products to its markets at prices which generate adequate returns
 natural disasters
 significant decrease in demand for the Company&amp;#x2019;s products or significant increase in the costs to manufacture the Company&amp;#x2019;s products.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Recoverability of assets is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset group to future net cash flows expected to be generated by the asset group.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;If such assets are considered to be impaired
 the impairment to be recognized is measured by the amount by which the carrying amount of the assets exceeds the fair value of the assets.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company groups its long-lived assets with other assets and liabilities at the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of the cash flows of other assets and liabilities (or asset group).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This would typically be at the winery level which is described in Note 2 above.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company did not recognize any impairment charges associated with long-lived assets during the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; year period ended December 31
 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:308.80pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;12.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:308.80pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The provision (benefit) for income taxes for years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013 are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:13.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;3
861&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:13.86%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;(2
335)
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 which&amp;nbsp;was declared on&amp;nbsp;February 1
 2013 with the shares distributed&amp;nbsp;on&amp;nbsp;February 25
 2013
 the Company and its subsidiaries were included in the consolidated federal and certain consolidated or combined state income tax returns of Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;However
 the provisions for income taxes in the consolidated&amp;nbsp;income statements&amp;nbsp;were determined on a theoretical separate-return basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Due to the Company&amp;#x2019;s history of pre-tax losses
 as of the Distribution date the Company did not reflect a benefit for its net operating loss carryforwards (&amp;#x201C;NOLs&amp;#x201D;) since the Company was unable to conclude it was more likely than not that it would have been able to generate future taxable income to use the NOLs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As noted in Note 3
 as of December 31
 2013 the Company determined that it was more likely than not that some of the tax benefit related to the deferred tax assets would be realized and reduced the valuation allowance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 accordingly &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;as of December 31
 2014
 it was determined that it is more likely than not that the remaining allowance would be realized and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;the Company &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;reduced the valuation allowance to zero.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 t&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;he Company filed a California state income tax return separate from Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company's income tax returns are subject to examination in the U.S. federal and state jurisdictions. To the extent the Company has unutilized net operating loss carryforwards
 the statute of limitations does not begin to run until the NOLs are utilized.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Therefore&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; for federal and state tax purposes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; the Company has tax &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;years open dating back to 2002.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company currently has no unrecognized tax benefits
 and it is not reasonably possible to estimate the amount by which that could increase in the next twelve months since the timing of examinations
 if any
 is unknown.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 no formal tax sharing agreement was entered into between the Company and Leucadia. On the Distribution date
 the Company and Leucadia entered into a tax matters agreement that governs the parties&amp;#x2019; respective rights
 responsibilities and obligations with respect to tax liabilities and benefits
 tax attributes
 the preparation and filing of tax returns
 the control of audits and other tax proceedings and other matters regarding taxes. In general
 with respect to any periods ending at or prior to the Distribution
 Leucadia will be responsible for any federal income tax liabilities and any state or local income taxes reportable on a consolidated
 combined or unitary return
 in each case
 as would be applicable to the Company as if it filed tax returns on a stand-alone basis. With respect to any periods beginning after the Distribution
 the Company will be responsible for any federal
 state or local income taxes of it or any of its subsidiaries. The Company will not be required to reimburse Leucadia for any payments made by Leucadia for adjustments to taxable periods prior to the Distribution
 nor will the Company be entitled to any refunds for adjustments to taxable periods prior to the Distribution. The Company is responsible for any adjustments or liabilities related to its California state income tax return for all periods.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Under certain circumstances
 the ability to use the NOLs and future deductions could be substantially reduced if certain changes in ownership were to occur. In order to reduce this possibility
 the Company&amp;#x2019;s certificate of incorporation includes a charter restriction that prohibits transfers of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock under certain circumstances.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Income taxes:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Income taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method
 which requires the recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the consolidated financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Under this method
 deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the differences between the financial statements and the tax basis of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The effect of a change in tax rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities is recognized in income in the period that includes the enacted date.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Net tax assets are recorded to the extent the Company believes these assets will more likely than not be realized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In making such determination
 the Company considers all available positive and negative evidence
 including scheduled reversals of deferred tax liabilities
 projected future taxable income
 tax planning strategies and recent financial results of operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Prior to 2013
 the Company had recorded a full valuation allowance related to its net deferred tax asset.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2013
 the Company determined it was more likely than not that a portion of the deferred tax asset would&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;be realized in the future
 and therefore reduced the valuation allowance resulting in the recognition of a net deferred tax asset of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2014
 the Company determined it is more likely than not that the remaining allowance will be realized in the future
 and therefore reduced the valuation allowance to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;zero&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and recognized the remaining &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million as a portion of the deferred tax asset.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 the Company and its subsidiaries were included in the consolidated federal and certain consolidated or combined state income tax returns of Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;However
 the provisions for income taxes in the consolidated income statements have been determined on a theoretical separate-return basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company does not have any unrecognized tax benefits; however
 if it did the Company would record accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits as income tax expense.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company records &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;deferred income tax liabilities and assets as noncurrent in its consolidated balance sheets (see &amp;#x2018;Recent accounting pronouncements&amp;#x2019; section within this footnote of Form 10-K for additional information on the adoption of this policy). &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;See Note 12 for more detail on income tax for the Company.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;7.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Intangible and Other Non-Current Assets&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;A summary of intangible and other non-current assets at December 31
 2015 and 2014 is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Inventory -&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market
 with cost being determined on the first-in
 first-out method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs associated with winemaking
 and other costs associated with the manufacturing of products for resale
 are recorded as inventory.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In accordance with general practice within the wine industry
 wine inventories are included in current assets
 although a portion of such inventories may be aged for periods longer than one year.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As required
 the Company reduces the carrying value of inventories that are obsolete or in excess of estimated usage to estimated net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company&amp;#x2019;s estimates of net realizable value are based on analyses and assumptions including
 but not limited to
 historical usage
 future demand and market requirements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Reductions to the carrying value of inventories are recorded in cost of sales.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;If future demand and/or pricing for the Company&amp;#x2019;s products are less than previously estimated
 then the carrying value of the inventories may be required to be reduced
 resulting in additional expense and reduced profitability.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Inventory write-downs of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; were recorded during the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s material financial instruments includ&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;e cash and cash equivalents
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;investments classified as available for sale&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;short-term and long-term debt&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;; investments classified as available for sale are the only assets or liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investments mature within &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years or less.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The par value
 amortized cost
 gross unrealized gains and losses and estimated fair value of investments classified as available for sale as of December 31
 2015 and 2014 are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Gross unrealized losses &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt;on available-for-sale securities were&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt;$0.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt; million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;color:#000000;&gt;as of December&amp;nbsp;31
 2015
 and the Company believes the gross unrealized losses are temporary as it does not intend to sell these securities and it is more likely than not that the Company will not be required to sell these securities before the recovery of their amortized cost basis.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of December 31
 2015 and 2014
 the Company did not have any &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For cash and cash equivalents
 the carrying amounts of such financial instruments approximate their fair values.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; &amp;nbsp;For short-term and long-term debt
 the carrying amounts of such financial instruments approximate their fair values.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;background-color: #FFFFFF;&gt;The Company has estimated the fair value of its short-term and long-term debt based upon discounted cash flows with Level 3 inputs
 such as the terms that management believes would currently be available to the Company for similar issues of debt
 taking into account the current credit risk of the Company and other factors. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

 routine litigation incidental to their business or not significant to the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial position or liquidity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company does not believe that there is any pending litigation that could have a significant adverse impact on its consolidated financial position
