					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:16.10%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;656&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:13.56%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:49.60%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:13.56%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;20
979&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:01.90%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:16.10%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:15.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;2
782&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Concentrations of risk:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company sells the majority of its wine through distributors and retailers.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Receivables arising from these sales are not collateralized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During the year ended December 31
 2015
 sales to two customers each accounted for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;10%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; of net sales
 and in the years ended December 31
 2014 and 2013 sales to one customer accounted for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;14%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; of total sales
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Amounts due from these customers represented approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;32%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; of accounts receivable as of December 31
 2015 and 2014
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company maintains its cash in bank deposit accounts that
 at times
 may exceed FDIC insurance &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;thresholds.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:332.75pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:332.75pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The Company is in the business of producing and selling ultra-premium and luxury wines (i.e.
 wines that retail for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$14&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; and over &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; per &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;750m&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;l bottle
 respectively).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Crimson is headquartered in Napa
 California and through its wholly-owned subsidiaries owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;four&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; wineries: Pine Ridge Vineyards
 Archery Summit
 Chamisal Vineyards and Seghesio Family Vineyards.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Pine Ridge was acquired in 1991 and has been conducting operations since 1978
 Crimson started Archery Summit in 1993
 Chamisal Vineyards was acquired in 2008 and has been conducting operations since 1973
 and Seghesio Family Vineyards was acquired in 2011 and has been conducting operations since 1895.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Additionally
 in 2005 and 2006 Crimson acquired Double Canyon vineyard land in the Horse Heaven Hills of Washington&amp;#x2019;s Columbia Valley.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Since 2010
 Double Canyon has produced wines in a third party custom crush facility.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Crimson&amp;#x2019;s model is a combination of direct to consumer sales and wholesale distributor&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;ales. The Company&amp;#x2019;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; wines are available through many principal retail channels for premium table wines
 including fine wine restaurants
 hotels
 specialty shops
 supermarkets and club stores
 in all states domestically and in over &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;40&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; countries throughout the world. References to cases of wine herein refer to nine-liter equivalent cases.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Pine Ridge Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;158&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres and controls through leasing arrangements an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;18&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres of estate vineyards in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; Napa Valley appellations &amp;#x2013; Stags Leap District
 Rutherford
 Oakville
 Carneros and Howell Mountain.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;166&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Archery Summit owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;01&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres and controls through leasing arrangements an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;17&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres of estate vineyards in the Willamette Valley
 Oregon.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;112&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Chamisal Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;99&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres of vineyards in the Edna Valley
 California
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;82&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Seghesio Family Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;318&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres of vineyards in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; Sonoma County appellations
 the Alexander Valley and Russian River Valley
 of which approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;289&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;acres &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Double Canyon Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;184&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres of vineyards in the Horse Heaven Hills of Washington
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;91&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Recent accounting pronouncements:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In April 2014
 the&amp;nbsp;FASB&amp;nbsp;issued ASU 2014-08
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements (Topic 205) and Property
 Plant and Equipment (Topic 360)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 which is guidance that changes the criteria for reporting discontinued operations. To qualify as a discontinued operation under the amended guidance
 a component or group of components of an entity that has been disposed of or is classified as held for sale must represent a strategic shift that has or will have a major effect on the entity's operations and financial results. These changes became effective for the Company on January 1
 2015. The adoption of this guidance did not have a material impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s&amp;nbsp;consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In May 2014
 the FASB issued ASU 2014-09
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Revenue fro&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;m Contracts with Customers (Topic 606)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which is guidance outlining a single comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting for revenue arising from contracts with customers that supersedes most current revenue recognition guidance. This guidance requires an entity to recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. Additionally
 this guidance expands related disclosure requirements. This guidance&amp;nbsp;becomes&amp;nbsp;effective for the Company on January 1
 2018
 and early adoption is permitted for the Company beginning on January 1
 2017. Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In August 2014
 the&amp;nbsp;FASB issued&amp;nbsp;ASU 2014-15
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements &amp;#x2013; Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which requires management of a company to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the Company&amp;#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern.&amp;nbsp;This guidance&amp;nbsp;becomes&amp;nbsp;effective&amp;nbsp;for the Company on January 1
 2017
 and early adoption is permitted. &amp;nbsp;Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In April 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-03
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Interest &amp;#x2013; Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which is guidance on the financial statement presentation of debt issuance costs. This guidance requires debt issuance costs to be presented in the balance sheet as a reduction of the related debt liability rather than an asset.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; August 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-15
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Interest-Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 an update to clarify ASU 2015-03
 which did not address the balance sheet presentation of debt issuance costs that are either (1) incurred before a debt liability is recognized (e.g. before the debt proceeds are received)
 or (2) associated with revolving debt arrangements. ASU 2015-15 states that the SEC staff would not object to an entity deferring and presenting debt issuance costs as an asset and subsequently amortizing deferred debt issuance costs ratably over the term of the LOC arrangement
 regardless of whether there are outstanding borrowings under that LOC arrangement. This standard became effective upon issuance and should be adopted concurrent with the adoption of ASU 2015-03.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;The Company early adopted ASU 2015-03 and ASU 2015-15 for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;its annual and interim periods beginning January 1
 2015 and applied retrospective treatment of the standard.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;The adoption of these ASU&amp;#x2019;s resulted in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million of debt issuance costs related to the term loan issued in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;November &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015 to be recorded as a reduction of the related debt on the Company&amp;#x2019;s balance sheet as of December 31
 2015.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The retrospective application had no impact on our balance sheet as of December&amp;nbsp;31
 2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In July 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-11
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Inventory (Topic 330)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which is guidance on the simplification for the measurement of inventory. This guidance requires that an entity should measure in scope inventory at the lower of cost and net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;This guidance&amp;nbsp;becomes&amp;nbsp;effective&amp;nbsp;for&amp;nbsp;the Company on January 1
 2017
 and early adoption is permitted. &amp;nbsp;Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In September 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-16
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Business Combinations (Topic 805)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 relating to measurement-period adjustments in business combinations. The new standard eliminates the requirement for retrospective treatment of measurement-period adjustments in a business combination. Instead
 a measurement-period adjustment will be recognized in the period in which the adjustment is determined. The guidance becomes effective for the Company on January 1
 2016
 and early adoption is permitted. Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;In November 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-17
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;&gt;Income Taxes (Topic 740)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which is guidance to simplify the presentation of deferred income taxes. The guidance requires that deferred income tax liabilities and assets be classified as noncurrent in a classified statement of financial position. This guidance&amp;nbsp;becomes&amp;nbsp;effective&amp;nbsp;for&amp;nbsp;the Company on January 1
 2017.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;Early adoption is permitted as of the beginning of any interim or annual reporting period.&amp;nbsp; Guidance may be applied either prospectively
 for all deferred tax assets and liabilities
 or retrospectively (i.e.
 by reclassifying the comparative balance sheet).&amp;nbsp; The Company early adopted ASU 2015-17 and applied retrospective treatment of the standard.&amp;nbsp; The retrospective reclassification results in a reduction in current assets
 total assets
 non-current liabilities and total liabilities of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; million &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt;as of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:10pt;&gt; December 31
 2014.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In January 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-01
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Financial Instruments &amp;#x2013; Overall (Subtopic 825-10)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;
 which is guidance related to accounting for equity investments
 financial liabilities under the fair value option
 and the presentation and disclosure requirements for financial instruments. In addition
 the FASB clarified guidance related to the valuation allowance assessment when recognizing deferred tax assets resulting from unrealized losses on available-for-sale debt securities. The guidance becomes effective for the Company on January 1
 2018
 and early adoption is permitted. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In February 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-02
 Leases (Topic 842)
 which is guidance to increase transparency and comparability&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;among organizations by recognizing lease assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet and disclosing key information about leasing arrangements.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;&gt;This guidance becomes effective for the Company on January 1
 2019.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Early adoption of ASU &lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name=jump_exp_4&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:inherit;&gt;2016-02 as of its issuance is permitted.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new leases standard requires a modified retrospective transition approach for all leases existing at
 or entered into after
 the date of initial application
 with an option to use certain transition relief.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Management is currently evaluating the potential impact of&amp;nbsp;this guidance&amp;nbsp;on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:325.70pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:325.70pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Explanatory Note&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Crimson Wine Group
 Ltd. (&amp;#x201C;Crimson&amp;#x201D;) is a Delaware corporation that has been operating since 1991.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As used herein
 the term &amp;#x201C;Company&amp;#x201D; refers to Crimson and its wholly-owned subsidiaries
 except as the context may otherwise require.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Prior to February 25
 2013
 Crimson was a wholly-owned subsidiary of Leucadia National Corporation (&amp;#x201C;Leucadia&amp;#x201D;).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On February 1
 2013
 Leucadia declared a pro rata dividend of all of the outstanding shares of Crimson&amp;#x2019;s common stock in a manner that was structured to qualify as a tax-free spin-off for U.S. federal income tax purposes (the &amp;#x201C;Distribution&amp;#x201D;).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Leucadia&amp;#x2019;s common shareholders received one share of Crimson common stock for every &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; common shares of Leucadia (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;24
458
368&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; Crimson common shares in the aggregate)
 with cash in lieu of fractional shares
 on February 25
 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The consolidated financial statements and notes thereto give retroactive effect to the Distribution for all periods presented.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Crimson qualifies as an &amp;#x201C;emerging growth company&amp;#x201D; as defined in the JOBS Act.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Crimson has elected to opt out of the extended transition period for complying with new or revised accounting standards pursuant to Section 107(b) of the JOBS Act.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This election is irrevocable.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;A 401(k) profit sharing plan is provided to all employees who meet certain service requirements. The Company matches &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; of a participant&amp;#x2019;s salary deferral
 subject to regulatory limitations.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Total C&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;ompany contributions to the plan were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million for each of the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013.&lt;/font&gt;

 is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In January 2013
 the Company sold a non-strategic vineyard for net cash consideration of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 after selling expenses.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recorded a pre-tax gain of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 net of closing costs
 during the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;year ended December 31
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In May 2014
 the Company sold a non-strategic unplanted parcel of land in Washington for net proceeds of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$3.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million after selling expenses.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recorded a pre-tax gain of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million
 net of closing costs
 during the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;year ended December 31
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; 2014.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Property and equipment:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Property and equipment are stated at cost and are depreciated using the straight-line method over the related assets estimated useful lives.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs of maintenance and repairs are charged to expense as incurred; significant renewals and betterments are capitalized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs incurred developing vineyards are capitalized until the vineyard becomes commercially productive.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:00.64%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:00.64%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:24.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:03.52%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:24.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;(a)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:95.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:24.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Income from operations in the quarterly periods for the year ended December 31
 2014 include&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; certain reclassifications that were made to conform to the current year&amp;#x2019;s presentation. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:00.64%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:03.52%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:95.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:00.64%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.25pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:03.52%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.25pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;(b)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:95.84%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.25pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Net (gain)/loss on the disposal of property and equipment previously reported was reclassified as a component of income&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; from operations to conform to&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; current year's presentation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Accounts receivable:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accounts receivable are reported at net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;background-color: #FFFFFF;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s accounts receivable balance is net of an allowance for doubtful accounts of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;background-color: #FFFFFF;&gt;$0.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;background-color: #FFFFFF;&gt; million at December 31
 2015 and 2014.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Interest is not accrued on past-due amounts.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accounts are charged against the allowance to bad debt as they are deemed uncollectible based upon a periodic review of the accounts.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In evaluating the collectability of individual receivable balances
 the Company considers several factors
 including the age of the balance
 the customer&amp;#x2019;s historical payment history
 its current credit worthiness and current economic trends.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;9.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Due to Leucadia and its Affiliates&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Amounts that were due to Leucadia and its affiliates did bear interest at a specified bank prime rate plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;0.125%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All amounts were payable on demand
 except for the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$45.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million note issued to Leucadia in connection with the acquisition of Seghesio Family Vineyards that was originally due May 13
 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Unpaid interest
 if any
 was added to the principal balance on a quarterly basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest expense to Leucadia and its affiliates was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; for the years ended December 31
 2015 and 2014 and was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$0.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million for the year ended December 31
 2013. On February 25
 2013
 the remaining balance of due to affiliates was contributed by Leucadia to capital.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Effective March 1
 2013
 the Company entered into an administrative service agreement with Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Pursuant to this agreement
 Leucadia provided certain administrative
 SEC
 tax filing and accounting services
 including providing the services of the Company&amp;#x2019;s Corporate Secretary.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 18pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Effective August 1
 2013
 Leucadia and the Company agreed to amend the administrative service agreement to reduce the administrative services provided to the Company by Leucadia and to terminate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;the agreement effective February 2014. Administrative services&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;expense was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 $9
000
 and $0.1 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;million for the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Revenue recognition:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recognizes revenue from product sales upon shipment or delivery provided that persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 which for sales to wholesalers is a purchase order
 the price is fixed
 title has transferred
 collection of resulting receivables is reasonably assured
 there are no customer acceptance requirements
 and there are no remaining significant obligations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The cost of depletion allowances and price promotions are treated as reductions of revenues and can be reasonably estimated based upon experience.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Revenue from products sold through retail locations
 wine clubs and the internet is recognized when the product is received by the customer and payment is received
 based on published retail prices and applicable published discounts.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Revenue includes any shipping and handling costs billed to the customer
 and such amounts are not expected to be sufficient to cover actual costs.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;&gt;14.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Business Segment Information&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;The Company has identified &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; operating segments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;which are reportable segments for financial statement reporting purposes
 Wholesale Sales and Direct to Consumer Sales
 based upon their different distribution channels
 margins and selling strategies.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Wholesale Sales includes all sales through a third party where prices are given at a wholesale rate whereas Direct to Consumer Sales includes retail sales in the tasting room
 remote sites and at on-site events
 Wine Club sales and other sales made directly to the consumer without&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; the use of an intermediary.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;The two segments reflect how the Company's operations are evaluated by senior management and the structure of its internal financial reporting. The Company evaluates performance based on the gross profit of the respective business segments. Selling expenses that can be directly attributable to the segment are&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;allocated accordingly. However
 centralized selling expenses and general and administrative expenses are not allocated between operating segments. Therefore
 net income information for the respective segments is not available.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Based on the nature of the Company&amp;#x2019;s business
 revenue generating assets are utilized across segments.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Therefore
 discrete financial information related to segment assets and other balance sheet data is not available and that information continues to be aggregated.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following table outlines the net sales
 cost of sales
 gross profit
 directly attributable selling expenses and operating income for the&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Company&amp;#x2019;s reportable&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;segments for the years ended December 31
 2015
 2014 and 2013
 and also includes a reconciliation of consolidated income (loss) from operations. Other/Non-allocable net sales and gross profit include bulk wine and grape sales
 event fees and retail sales. Other/Non-allocable expenses include centralized corporate expenses not specific to an identified reporting segment.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Sales figures are net of related excise taxes.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:9pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:05.00%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;9
083&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.04%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
